episodeTitle: The Desperate Scream! Courageous Moments That Will Change the Future
episodeTitleJapanese: 必死の叫び 運命を変える勇気ある数秒
episodeTitleRomanized: Hisshi no Sakebi - Unmei o Kaeru Yūki aru Sūbyō
description: As the Battle of Marineford reaches its climax, Trafalgar Law arrives to rescue Luffy while Blackbeard's earthquake powers threaten to sink Marineford. Koby, overwhelmed by the voices of the dying, makes a desperate plea for the fighting to stop. Just as Akainu moves to execute him, Shanks arrives to end the war, declaring that Koby's courage will change the world.

events.title: Blackbeard Uses Gura Gura no Mi to Tilt Marineford
events.description: Marshall D. Teach (Blackbeard) demonstrates his mastery of the Gura Gura no Mi (Tremor-Tremor Fruit) by grabbing the sky and swinging his hands down, causing massive earthquakes. He tilts the entire island of Marineford with an attack called 'Shima Yurashi', creating chaos as the ocean, sky, and island shake violently.
events.significance: This moment showcases Blackbeard's devastating new power after stealing Whitebeard's Devil Fruit ability. His inexperience with the power is noted, foreshadowing his future growth. The attack creates tsunamis that reach as far as Sabaody Archipelago, demonstrating the world-changing scale of this conflict.

quotes.text: I'll sink Marineford to the bottom of the ocean!
quotes.speaker: Blackbeard
quotes.context: Blackbeard threatens to destroy Marineford using the earthquake powers

events.title: Tsunami Reaches Sabaody Archipelago
events.description: The effects of Blackbeard's earthquake powers reach far beyond Marineford. Sirens wail at Sabaody Archipelago as a massive tsunami approaches. When Blackbeard shifts the seas, the tsunami paradoxically saves the Heart Pirates from a naval bombardment, allowing them to prepare for Luffy's rescue.
events.significance: Demonstrates the global impact of the Marineford War and the terrifying range of the Gura Gura no Mi's power. The tsunami affecting distant islands shows how this battle is literally shaking the world.

events.title: Trafalgar Law's Submarine Arrives at Marineford
events.description: Trafalgar Law and the Heart Pirates arrive at Marineford in their submarine, navigating through the chaos of the battlefield. Law has come to rescue Monkey D. Luffy and Jinbe from the warzone, offering them a means of escape.
events.significance: This marks Law's intervention in the war and establishes his relationship with Luffy. Law's decision to save Luffy, despite the risk, becomes a pivotal moment that shapes the future of the series and the alliance between the Straw Hats and Heart Pirates.

quotes.text: Bring Straw Hat Luffy to me!
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law commands his crew to prepare to receive Luffy

events.title: Buggy Carries Luffy and Jinbe
events.description: Buggy the Clown, despite his cowardice, carries the unconscious Luffy and the injured Jinbe across the battlefield toward Law's submarine. He complains about Law being a doctor armed with a sword but continues to help, showing unexpected courage.
events.significance: Demonstrates Buggy's hidden nobility and his role in saving Luffy's life. Despite his fear and complaints, Buggy rises to the occasion during the most critical moment, contributing to Luffy's survival.

quotes.text: A doctor armed with a sword?! What kind of doctor are you?!
quotes.speaker: Buggy
quotes.context: Buggy complains while carrying Luffy and Jinbe to Law

events.title: Navy Closes In on Law's Submarine
events.description: Navy ships begin to surround Law's submarine as it attempts to extract Luffy and Jinbe. Kizaru prepares to fire a light blast to destroy the submarine and finish Luffy once and for all, creating a desperate situation.
events.significance: Creates the tension that makes Koby's intervention so crucial. Without Koby's desperate cry, Kizaru would have destroyed the submarine and killed Luffy, changing the entire trajectory of the series.

events.title: Koby's Observation Haki Awakens
events.description: Koby collapses, clutching his head as he experiences the awakening of Observation Haki. He begins having horrible visions of pirates killing Marines and vice versa, overwhelmed by sensing every human presence on the battlefield. The voices of combatants disappear one by one as they die, reducing him to tears and mental anguish.
events.significance: This is Koby's awakening to Haki through extreme stress and trauma. The awakening is involuntary and overwhelming, as he lacks the mental fortitude to handle passively empathizing with the negative emotions and deaths of hundreds of people. This moment is crucial to Koby's development as a future Marine hero.

quotes.text: The voices... they're fading away... one by one!
quotes.speaker: Koby
quotes.context: Koby describes his overwhelming experience of sensing deaths through Observation Haki

events.title: Koby's Desperate Plea to Stop the War
events.description: Koby trips over a dead Marine and finds a necklace with a picture of the fallen soldier's family. Overwhelmed by grief and moral conviction, he stands in the middle of the battlefield and screams at the top of his lungs, begging both sides to stop fighting. He argues that the Marines have already won, that further fighting only wastes precious lives of soldiers who have families waiting for them, and questions what the Marines are trying to prove by continuing the slaughter.
events.significance: This is one of the most courageous moments in the entire series. A young, low-ranking Marine stands against the entire war machine, risking execution to save lives. Koby's cry creates the brief pause that allows Law to escape with Luffy, literally saving the protagonist's life. Shanks later declares that these 'seconds of courage changed the fate of the world,' recognizing the profound impact of this moment.

quotes.text: Please stop! The fighting is over! We've already won! Each of these soldiers has a family waiting for them! To keep shedding blood... to keep taking lives... is that really justice?!
quotes.speaker: Koby
quotes.context: Koby's desperate plea to end the war

events.title: Akainu Attempts to Execute Koby
events.description: Admiral Akainu, enraged by Koby's speech, views it as a waste of precious seconds in the war and a betrayal of Marine justice. He moves to execute Koby with a magma fist, declaring that soldiers who halt the march of justice deserve death.
events.significance: Shows Akainu's ruthless philosophy of absolute justice, where even questioning orders in the name of morality is punishable by death. This moment crystallizes Akainu as the embodiment of extreme military ideology and sets up the dramatic intervention by Shanks.

quotes.text: Foolish soldiers who would waste precious seconds of this war deserve death!
quotes.speaker: Akainu
quotes.context: Akainu justifies executing Koby for speaking out against the war

events.title: Shanks Arrives at Marineford
events.description: Just as Akainu's magma fist is about to kill Koby, a sword blocks the attack. Red-Haired Shanks has arrived at Marineford with his crew. The battlefield falls into stunned silence as one of the Four Emperors makes his entrance, casually blocking a Marine Admiral's attack.
events.significance: This is one of the most iconic moments in One Piece history. Shanks' arrival marks a turning point in the war and the series. His dramatic entrance, timing, and the sheer power display of casually blocking Akainu establishes the Yonko's overwhelming presence. This moment has been referenced countless times and is considered one of the greatest 'entrance' scenes in anime.

quotes.text: That's enough. This young Marine's life... I'll take responsibility for it.
quotes.speaker: Shanks
quotes.context: Shanks' first words upon arriving at Marineford

events.title: Shanks Declares Koby Will Change the World
events.description: Shanks picks up his straw hat and, while looking at Koby, declares that 'these few seconds of courage you displayed will greatly change the fate of the world, for better or worse.' He acknowledges the profound significance of Koby's actions.
events.significance: Shanks, possibly using advanced Observation Haki (Future Vision), recognizes Koby's potential to become a major figure who will shape the world's future. This prophecy sets up Koby's eventual rise to prominence and suggests his actions at Marineford will have far-reaching consequences. The statement also validates Koby's moral courage.

quotes.text: These few seconds of courage you displayed will greatly change the fate of the world, for better or worse.
quotes.speaker: Shanks
quotes.context: Shanks prophesizes about the impact of Koby's actions

events.title: Shanks Announces He Will End the War
events.description: With the entire Marine force and remaining pirates watching in shock, Shanks announces that he has come to put an end to the war. His presence and authority are so overwhelming that even the Marines, who are technically victorious, prepare to listen.
events.significance: Demonstrates Shanks' unique position in the world as someone who can command respect from all sides. His intervention ends the bloodiest conflict in recent One Piece history and prevents further catastrophic casualties. This moment establishes Shanks as a peacekeeper despite being a pirate.

quotes.text: I've come here to put an end to this war!
quotes.speaker: Shanks
quotes.context: Shanks declares his intention to stop the Marineford War

events.title: Benn Beckman Holds Kizaru at Gunpoint
events.description: Benn Beckman, Shanks' first mate, appears behind Admiral Kizaru and points his rifle at him, threatening to shoot if Kizaru moves a muscle. Despite being a light human who normally moves at light speed, Kizaru complies and raises his hands, showing respect for Beckman's threat.
events.significance: Demonstrates the incredible power and threat level of Shanks' crew. The fact that Kizaru, one of the strongest Marines, stops his attack on Luffy out of respect for Beckman's threat speaks volumes about the Red Hair Pirates' strength. This moment allows Law's submarine to escape.

events.title: Law's Submarine Escapes with Luffy and Jinbe
events.description: With Koby's cry creating a moment's pause and Benn Beckman stopping Kizaru, Trafalgar Law's submarine successfully submerges and escapes from Marineford with the unconscious Luffy and injured Jinbe on board. Jean Bart secures them below deck as the Heart Pirates flee the battlefield.
events.significance: Luffy's escape from Marineford is successful, allowing him to survive and continue his journey. This moment marks the beginning of Law's alliance with Luffy and sets up the two-year time skip. Without this escape, the entire series would have ended here.

quotes.speaker: Koby
quotes.context: Koby's desperate plea to end the Marineford War

themes.description: The episode explores true justice through Koby's actions. Despite being a low-ranking Marine who could be executed for insubordination, Koby speaks out against the senseless continuation of violence. His definition of justice centers on protecting life rather than blindly following orders.
themes.symbolism: The dead Marine's family photo represents the human cost of war and the lives behind every soldier.

themes.description: Koby's observation haki forces him to experience every death on the battlefield, giving him an overwhelming understanding of the cost of war. His plea emphasizes that every soldier has a family and a life worth preserving.
themes.symbolism: Koby's tears and physical collapse represent the weight of feeling so many lives being extinguished.

themes.description: Shanks' statement that Koby's 'seconds of courage' will change the world encapsulates a core One Piece theme: that individual bravery, even from the seemingly powerless, can alter the course of history.
themes.symbolism: Those few seconds of Koby standing alone against the war represent how single acts of courage can have rippling effects.

themes.description: The contrast between Akainu's willingness to execute Koby for questioning orders and Shanks' validation of that same courage highlights different philosophies of justice within the One Piece world.
themes.symbolism: Akainu's magma fist represents destructive, uncompromising justice, while Shanks' sword blocking it represents mercy and wisdom.

characterSpotlights.development: Koby awakens to Observation Haki through trauma and demonstrates unprecedented courage by standing against the entire war. This moment represents the culmination of his growth from a coward to someone willing to risk death for his beliefs.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends several scenes for dramatic effect, particularly Koby's internal struggle with his awakening Observation Haki, which is shown in more visual detail than the manga.

trivia.fact: Episode 488 has an IMDb rating of 9.6/10, making it one of the highest-rated episodes in the entire One Piece anime series.
The episode achieved an 11.1% TV rating in Japan and ranked 3rd in its time slot, demonstrating the massive viewership for this climactic episode.
Shanks' arrival at Marineford is considered one of the most iconic entrance scenes in anime history, frequently appearing in 'best anime moments' compilations.
This episode covers Chapter 579 (pages 2-17) of the manga, showing the anime's pacing during the Marineford Arc.
The opening song 'One day' by The ROOTLESS was specifically chosen for the Marineford Arc due to its somber tone, contrasting with previous openings and reflecting the tragic events of the arc.
